creator: jari.aalto@cante.net
text:
Here is compile report under latest cygwin - latest httpd CVS 2.0.
config.log at the end.

-- jari.aalto@poboxes.com


gcc (GCC) 3.1.1 20020714 (prerelease)
GNU Make version 3.79.1
hostname = W2KPICASSO
uname -m = i686
uname -r = 1.3.11(0.53/3/2)
uname -s = CYGWIN_NT-5.0
uname -v = 2002-06-21 22:04


Found newer headers. Will rebuild aprutil.exp.
rm -f aprutil.exp
gcc -E -DHAVE_CONFIG_H -DCYGWIN   -I/usr/src/cvs-source/httpd-2.0/srclib/apr-
util/include -I/usr/src/cvs-source/httpd-2.0/srclib/apr-util/include/private  -
I/usr/src/cvs-source/httpd-2.0/srclib/apr/include    exports.c | 
grep "ap_hack_" | sed -e 's/^.*[)]\(.*\);$/\1/' >> aprutil.exp
gcc -E -DHAVE_CONFIG_H -DCYGWIN   -I/usr/src/cvs-source/httpd-2.0/srclib/apr-
util/include -I/usr/src/cvs-source/httpd-2.0/srclib/apr-util/include/private  -
I/usr/src/cvs-source/httpd-2.0/srclib/apr/include    export_vars.h | sed -
e 's/^\#[^!]*//' | sed -e '/^$/d' >> aprutil.exp

creator: nd@perlig.de
text:
Sorry for the late response ... Does the problem still exist?
If not I'd consider this as fixed.

Note also, that CVS versions do not always compile on all systems, because a
single committing developer cannot test all systems before.

Thanks for using Apache!

creator: jari.aalto@cante.net
text:
Thank you for addressing this, yes, the problem still persists, Herei slatest 
CVS (cvs up as of 2002-02-13) and compile results. I'm running the latest 
W2k/Cygwin version 

The config.log is identical as in my previous message. I did not change a bit, 
just updated from CVS and ran "make". please let me know what information you 
would need to help with this.
Jari

creator: nd@perlig.de
text:
strange...
My guess is for now: autoconf.

could you try newer autoconf and libtool? ISTR that there were problems with
older versions.

(I don't have a cygwin environment at the moment to test it myself, sorry!)

creator: nd@perlig.de
text:
Assuming local problem solved. Please reopen this report if this is not the case
and you can supply the requested information.

Thanks.
